about_the_game:
You should read the main game store page for the full description of the game.

In the full game, you have access to the three levels of the manor, while in the demo, you are limited to the area outside of it and it finishes as soon as you've read the "message on the door."

The demo itself does not have any other limits. You can launch it as many times as you want, scores and achievements are working, and they will be transferred to the full game if you decide to go for it!

In terms of what to do, well, most of the action happens inside the manor, but there are still quite a few things to inspect, items to collect and combine, and at least three different ways to reach the game over sequence. The full game just has more of that, so the demo should give you a pretty good idea of what to expect.

content_descriptors.notes:
In this full game you play the role of a private investigator who has been asked to locate and free a kidnapped teenager. In the process the player will encounter a couple of dangerous obstacles they will have to take care of. The player is given some lethal and non lethal options to solve these obstacles.

At no point is any blood or explicit violence shown, but if you are not comfortable with the topic of abduction by thugs, you should probably not play this game.

The demo itself ends before any encounter happens, but the main thematic stays the same.
